definition: scattered/loose/to come loose/to fall apart/leisurely/powdered medicine
to scatter/to break up (a meeting etc)/to disperse/to disseminate/to dispel/(coll.) to sack
to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)

sentences.english: The utility model can effectively avoid foreign odor and harmful gas emitted by the contamination of the drain.
sentences.chinese: 能有效避免排污管被污染而散發異味和有害氣體。

sentences.english: That mixture is enough to move his jeep; however, whenever the car moves, it exhales food smell.
sentences.chinese: 當車子開動時，總是會散發出食物的味道。

sentences.english: Dynamic energy exudes off the skin as the elements of exotica let us join in.
sentences.chinese: 動態能量散發出掉皮膚新奇的元素，讓我們加入。

sentences.english: The soap lathers up in an instant and gives off an expensive scent.
sentences.chinese: 這種肥皂會立即起泡並散發出高雅香味。

sentences.english: She faces charges of inciting racial hatred by distributing anti-semitic leaflets.
sentences.chinese: 她因散發反猶傳單而面臨着煽動種族仇恨的指控。

sentences.english: They were also very dirty and their hair smelled even after four washings, the report said.
sentences.chinese: 兩人身上很髒，頭髮洗了四次仍散發着惡臭。

sentences.english: Deep violet-red wine, with ripe berry and spicy aromas.
sentences.chinese: 此酒呈深紫紅色，散發出成熟漿果和香料的芳香。

sentences.english: He sends ahead a strong murderous look and all step by step walks to the dollars.
sentences.chinese: 他散發出強大的殺氣，向元都一步步走去。

sentences.english: He was sent forth to scatter the leaflets.
Our sterling silver strawberry charm captures the essence of this quintessentially summer fruit.
sentences.chinese: 我們由純銀製成的草莓吊飾，散發着夏曰果子的氣息。

sentences.english: Delicately fragranced with Almond Flowers and Honey.
sentences.chinese: 散發淡淡的清香與杏仁花和蜂蜜。

sentences.english: Then he distributed leaflets to the other assistants to explain the action program.
sentences.chinese: 然後他散發傳單給其他助手來解釋行動方案。

sentences.english: The entire work distributed charming smell.
sentences.chinese: 整幅作品散發迷人的氣味。

sentences.english: Although their juices had run dry， the leaves still exuded a pleasant aroma.
sentences.chinese: 儘管已乾枯，落葉仍散發出好聞的香味。

sentences.english: The whole image-building shall give out such feeling.
sentences.chinese: 整個的形象塑造都將這種氣息散發出來。

sentences.english: They distributed political pamphlets in the hall.
sentences.chinese: 他們在大廳裏散發政治小冊子。

definition: to own exclusively/unique to/specific/there is only
to pervade/to fill the air/diffuse/everywhere present/about to inundate (water)/permeated by (smoke)/filled with (dust)/to saturate (the air with fog, smoke etc)
to stand out from the masses (idiom)
to come out/to emerge/to reveal/to display
